am_devices_mspi_psram_aps25616ba_1p2v.h File Reference

Multi-bit SPI PSRAM driver for the APS25616BA 1.2V device. More...

Detailed Description

Multi-bit SPI PSRAM driver for the APS25616BA 1.2V device.

#include "am_bsp.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

Global definitions for psram commands
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_GLOBAL_RESET   0xFFFF
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_READ   0x2020
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_WRITE   0xA0A0
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_READ_REGISTER   0x4040
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_DDR_WRITE_REGISTER   0xC0C0
 
Device specific identification.
Note
The following definitions are typically specific to a multibit spi psram device. They should be tailored
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_PAGE_SIZE   1024
 
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_TEST_BLOCK_SIZE   8*1024
 
Global definitions for the MSPI instance to use.
#define AM_DEVICES_MSPI_PSRAM_MAX_DEVICE_NUM   AM_REG_MSPI_NUM_MODULES

Function Documentation

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps25616ba_apply_ddr_timing()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps25616ba_apply_ddr_timing ( void * pHandle,
am_devices_mspi_psram_ddr_timing_config_t * pDevDdrCfg )
extern

Apply given DDR timing settings to target MSPI instance.

Parameters
pHandle- Handle to the PSRAM.
pDevDdrCfg- Pointer to the ddr timing config structure

This function applies the ddr timing settings to the selected mspi instance. This function must be called after MSPI instance is initialized into ENABLEFINEDELAY0 = 1 mode.

Returns
32-bit status

◆ am_devices_mspi_psram_aps25616ba_ddr_init_timing_check()

uint32_t am_devices_mspi_psram_aps25616ba_ddr_init_timing_check ( uint32_t module,
am_devices_mspi_psram_config_t * pDevCfg,
am_devices_mspi_psram_ddr_timing_config_t * pDevDdrCfg )
extern

Checks PSRAM timing and determine a delay setting.

Parameters
module- MSPI Module Number.
pDevCfg- Pointer to the psram device config structure
pDevDdrCfg- Pointer to the ddr timing config structure

This function scans through the delay settings of MSPI DDR mode and selects the best parameter to use by tuning TURNAROUND/RXNEG/RXDQSDELAY0 values. This function is only valid in DDR mode and ENABLEDQS0 = 0.

Returns
32-bit status, scan result in structure type
